FuncDef:
The npe-upe mac-withdraw enable command configures an NPE to forward the LDP MAC Withdraw messages received from other NPEs to UPEs.
The undo npe-upe mac-withdraw enable command disables an NPE from forwarding the LDP MAC Withdraw messages received from other NPEs to UPEs.
By default, an NPE does not forward the LDP MAC Withdraw messages received from other NPEs to UPEs.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command is mainly used on the gateway on the Metro Ethernet where:
NPE refers to the network end peer of the local VSI in HVPLS. You can run the peer peer-address [ negotiation-vc-id vc-id ] [ tnl-policy policy-name ] command to specify an NPE.UPE refers to the user end peer of the local VSI in HVPLS. You can run the peer peer-address [ negotiation-vc-id vc-id ] [ tnl-policy policy-name ] upe command to specify a UPE.If the local device is not configured with HVPLS, the npe-upe mac-withdraw enable command is not required.
